intro: Acinodendron inaequalifolium, commonly known as the unequal-leaved acinodendron, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, asymmetrical leaf shapes. The plant typically grows in humid, tropical environments and thrives in shaded, moist conditions. Its leaves are opposite and often have a rough texture, while the flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
